data.name: getFileContent
data.result:
#!/bin/bash
rm -Rf linux-amd64
rm -f helm-v4.0.1-linux-amd64.tar.gz.sha256sum
curl -LO "https://get.helm.sh/helm-v4.0.1-linux-amd64.tar.gz"
curl -LO "https://get.helm.sh/helm-v4.0.1-linux-amd64.tar.gz.sha256sum"
echo "$(cat helm-v4.0.1-linux-amd64.tar.gz.sha256sum)" | sha256sum --check
rm -f helm-v4.0.1-linux-amd64.tar.gz.sha256sum
tar -zxvf helm-v4.0.1-linux-amd64.tar.gz
rm -f helm-v4.0.1-linux-amd64.tar.gz

data.content:
I can see the current script uses Helm v4.0.1 and needs to be updated to v4.1.0. Here are the changes needed:

## Changes Required for `esm-helm/usr/lib/esm/helm/download-helm.sh`

The script needs to be updated to change all occurrences of `v4.0.1` to `v4.1.0`:

**Current version:** `helm-v4.0.1-linux-amd64.tar.gz`
**New version:** `helm-v4.1.0-linux-amd64.tar.gz`

The updated script should be:

rm -Rf linux-amd64
rm -f helm-v4.1.0-linux-amd64.tar.gz.sha256sum
curl -LO "https://get.helm.sh/helm-v4.1.0-linux-amd64.tar.gz"

tar -zxvf helm-v4.1.0-linux-amd64.tar.gz

data.content:
Update the file `esm-helm/usr/lib/esm/helm/download-helm.sh` to upgrade Helm from v4.0.1 to v4.1.0.

Make the following replacements throughout the file:
1. Replace `helm-v4.0.1-linux-amd64.tar.gz` with `helm-v4.1.0-linux-amd64.tar.gz` (appears 4 times)
2. Replace `helm-v4.0.1-linux-amd64.tar.gz.sha256sum` with `helm-v4.1.0-linux-amd64.tar.gz.sha256sum` (appears 3 times)

The final file should contain:
